column2: IDAHO DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
1. This road sign means:
column4: A left turn can be made only after stopping
column8: All traffic must turn right at the next intersection

column2: 2. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
column8: even if they are short sighted.

column2: 3. Drive below the posted speed limit when:
column4: you are on a four lane road.
column6: entering a highway where there are other cars.
column8: anything makes conditions less than perfect.
column10: others drive below the speed limit.

column2: 4. This sign means:
column8: There is a traffic signal ahead

column2: 5. When entering a crowded freeway, to merge into traffic you should:
column4: yield to vehicles already on the freeway.
column8: use the acceleration lane to adjust your speed to the same speed as freeway traffic.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
7. A broken white line:
column4: marks the right edge of the roadway.
column6: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.
column8: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.

column2: 8. When driving in fog:
9. When driving behind a motorcycle, drivers must:
column4: pass the motorcycle in the same lane.
column6: drive on the shoulder beside the motorcycle.
column8: share the lane with the motorcycle.
column10: remembers that motorcyclists have the right to use a complete traffic lane.

column2: 10. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights, you must:
column6: pull to the curb and stop.
column8: speed up and take the nearest exit.
column10: slow down and keep moving in your lane.

column2: 11. Drinking alcoholic beverages:
column8: gives you a feeling of false confidence.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
13. ___________ are green with white letters and symbols.
14. A speed restriction sign:
column6: must be ignored in snow conditions.
column10: shows the recommended speed for a curve/turn.

column2: 15. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column4: pass other vehicles and then stop.
column8: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.
column10: look both ways and be ready to stop.

column2: 16. This sign is a:
17. After stopping for a school bus that is unloading children you should:
column4: watch for children walking along the side of the road.

column2: 18. A large vehicle is backing up to unload goods. You should:
column6: enter one of the blind spots and wait.
column8: be patient and wait until the large vehicle has completed its backup maneuver.

column2: 19. What is the meaning of blue traffic signs?
column4: Blue indicates pedestrian crossings and school zones.
column6: A blue background indicates a regulatory sign.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column4: No turns are allowed on this road

column2: 21. As you approach an intersection, the traffic light changes from green to yellow. You should:
column4: speed up to beat the red light.
column6: be prepared to stop in the middle of the intersection.
column8: be prepared to stop before the intersection.
column10: apply the brakes sharply and come to a complete stop.

column2: 22. Drivers can proceed through an intersection with a stop sign, but no stop line or crosswalk:
column4: after coming to a complete stop, when it is safe to proceed.
column6: after stopping at least 50 feet prior to the intersection.
column8: after slowing down to at least 15 MPH before proceeding.
column10: after slowing down to ensure there is no cross-traffic.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column4: Right turn permitted on red light

column2: 24. An orange-colored sign means:
25. Before turning left, it is important to:
column4: sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column8: swing to the right side of your lane.
column10: flash your headlights to alert the other drivers.

column2: 26. When you approach this sign, you must:
column6: watch for workers crossing the road.

column2: 27. A speed limit is the __________ speed at which a vehicle may legally travel on the road under ideal conditions.
28. Highway hypnosis is a driving condition that can result from:
column10: staring at the roadway for long periods of time.

column2: 29. Drivers under 21 years of age are considered to be driving under the influence if their blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is:
30. Vehicle stopping distance never depends on:
column4: the condition of your vehicle's brakes.
column8: the condition and type of vehicle tires.

column2: 31. ___________ are the most frequent fatality in work zone crashes.
32. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column4: only if the traffic signal turns red.
column6: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.

column2: 33. When you enter a freeway exit ramp:
column4: pass slower vehicles on the right.
column6: don’t slow down on the freeway itself. Wait until you are in the deceleration lane.
column8: maintain your speed once in the exit ramp.
column10: slow down before entering the exit ramp.

column2: 34. ___________ normally are white rectangles with black letters or symbols.
35. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column4: Keep your vehicle in good condition.
column6: Do not drive if you are very weary.

column2: 36. The octagonal shape is used:
column6: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.
column10: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.

column2: 37. When making a turn, drivers must _____ their speed.
38. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.
column6: they approach a curve on a two-way road and can not see around it.
column8: their lane has a solid yellow center line.

column2: 39. When you are driving in the right lane of a freeway, you should allow room for vehicles merging onto the freeway by:
column4: using your emergency flashers to make them aware of your presence.
column6: slowing way down to allow them access.
column8: always driving in the far left lane.
column10: moving into the next lane to allow them access.

column2: 40. When an approaching driver at night blinds you by failing to dim their high beams, you should look:
column4: towards the left side of the road.
column6: straight down the middle of the road.
column8: None of the other answers is correct.
column10: towards the right side of the road.
